alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 1:40PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Utah... Duchesne River near Randlett affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river and stream flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Duchesne River near Randlett. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, minor flooding is expected across low-lying agricultural land along the Duchesne River. At 13.3 feet, fields become inundated along the river, southeast of Randlett. Some private bridges and irrigation works may also experience damage from high water and/or debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise this week, and remain above bankfull conditions. Expect a temporary plateau in water levels late tonight, at 11.7 feet. Then, water continues to rise into the holiday weekend, reaching 12.5 feet by Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 11.6 feet. - Flood stage is 13.3 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
